node.title: Kiwi ski star Robinson forced out of World Cup event after contracting COVID-19
node.description: The 20-year-old didn't feature in the Super G race in France overnight.
node.content: ["Rising Kiwi ski star Alice Robinson has withdrawn from her World Cup event in France after testing positive for COVID-19.", "Overnight Sunday (NZ time), the 20-year-old took to social media to confirm the reasons she had been forced out of the Super G race, just a week after she'd shot to a fourth-place finish in the same discipline in St Moritz.", "\"So some of you may have seen that I didn't race the Super G in Val d'sere today. Unfortunately I've tested positive to Covid-19 this past week while at my base in Italy and have been in isolation since.", "\"This means I will probably have to sit out the 2 GS races this coming week in Courchevel which I am extremely disappointed about.", "\"I'm doing fine and just aiming to recover as quickly as I can and try to get back on the slopes as soon as possible,\"\u00a0", "A giant slalom specialist, Robinson has been improving rapidly in the Super G skis with the hope to add the event to her slate for February's winter Olympic Games in Beijing.", "\u00a0"]
